Description:
IN/SPD191121/01-312080598
You have failed to ensure that the exposure of your employees to wood dust, which is a substance hazardous to health is either prevented or, where this is not reasonably practicable, adequately controlled in that; you have failed to establish appropriate work processes and provide suitable work equipment (i.e. sufficient class M type vacuum cleaners) for cleaning activities and, as a consequence, dry sweeping is being carried out to clear wood dust in the workshop.

IN/SPD191121/02-312080638
You have failed to ensure that the exposure of your employees to wood dust, which is a substance hazardous to health is either prevented or, where this is not reasonably practicable, adequately controlled in that; you have failed to provide adequate engineering controls (such as an appropriately designed local exhaust ventilation system) to control wood dust at the source of production at the crosscut saw.

IN/SPD191121/03-312080645
You have failed to place the workshop employees under suitable health surveillance (which should include testing of their hearing) when the risk assessment (noise surveys) carried out indicate that there is a risk to their health from noise exposure because they are frequently being exposed to noise levels above the upper exposure action value (LEP,d85dB).

IN/SPD191121/04-312080654
You have failed to ensure that the person(s) appointed to assist you in undertaking the measures required to comply with the requirements of; The Health and Safety at Work etc Act 1974 and the relevant statutory provisions made under the Act, have sufficient knowledge and training and, are given adequate time and means at their disposal, to properly assist in undertaking these measures (having regard to the risks (particularly to their health) to which your employees are exposed).
